name: Biomass Combustors
text: Requires 6% oxygen. Decrease any plant production 1 step and increase your energy production 2 steps.
description: Burning wood is easy

name: Corporate Stronghold
text: Decrease your energy production 1 step and increase your mega credit production 3 steps. Place a city tile.
description: A city exclusively devoted to your corporation

name: Heat Trappers
text: Decrease any heat production 2 steps and increase your energy production 1 step.
description: Utilizing temperature gradients for energy production

name: Water Splitting Plant
action: Spend 3 energy to raise oxygen 1 step.
text: Requires 2 ocean tiles
description: Electrolysis of water yields oxygen and hydrogen, both very useful gases

name: Satellites
text: Increase your mega credit production 1 step for each space tag you have, including this
description: Coordinating orbital traffic

name: Protected Valley
text: Increase your mega credit production 2 steps. Place a greenery tile ON AN AREA RESERVED FOR OCAEN, disregarding normal placement restrictions, and increase oxygen 1 step.
description: A fertile valley with higher air density and humidity, but in need of protection when the oceans rise

name: Protected Habitats
text: OPPONENTS MAY NOT REMOVE YOUR plant, animal, or microbes
description: The harsh environment is not the only threat to your ecological projects

name: Pets
text: ANIMALS MAY NOT BE REMOVED FROM THIS CARD. Add 1 animal to this card.
effect: When any city tile is placed, add an animal to this card.
description: It wouldn't be the same without them

name: Magnetic Field Dome
text: Decrease your energy production 2 steps and increase your plant production 1 step. Raise your terraform rating 1 step.
description: Protecting a limited area from cosmic radiation

name: Aerobraked Ammonia Asteroid
text: Add 2 microbes to ANOTHER card. Increase your heat production 3 steps and your plant production 1 step.
description: Ammonia is a greenhouse gas, as well as being a convenient nitrogen source for organisms

name: Shuttles
text: Requires 5% oxygen. Decrease your energy production 1 step and increase your mega credit production 2 steps
effect: When you play a space card, you pay 2 mega credit less for it.
description: Aided by low gravity going up, and by the increasing atmosphere when gliding down for landing

name: Strip Mine
text: Decrease your energy production 2 steps. Increase your steel production 2 steps and your titanium production 1 step. Raise oxygen 2 steps.
description: It is not exactly environmentally friendly to just dig up the surface, but it can be profitable

name: Cartel
text: Increase your mega credit production 1 step for each Earth tag you have, including this.
description: We see it as brotherhood

name: Micro-Mills
text: Increase your heat production 1 step
description: Small, mass-produced windmills that convert some of the ever-present wind into heat

name: Anti-Gravity Technology
effect: When you play a card, you pay 2 mega credit less for it
text: Requires 7 science tags
description: Finally successful, anti-gravity will revolutionize everything, from households to industry and space travel

name: CEO's Favorite Project
text: ADD 1 RESOURCE TO A CARD WITH AT LEAST 1 RESOURCE ON IT
description: Having the top man's attention, the involved people are sure to do their best

name: Insects
text: Requires 6% oxygen. Increase your plant production 1 step for each plant tag you have
description: Pollinating flowers and spreading seeds

name: Herbivores
effect: When you place a greenery tile, add an animal to this card.
text: Requires 8% oxygen. Add 1 animal to this card. Decrease any plant production 1 step.
vp: 1 VP per 2 animals on this card
description: Inhabiting the green hills of Mars

name: Nitrophilic Moss
text: Requires 3 ocean tiles and that you lose 2 plants. Increase your plant production 2 steps.
description: Specially made to thrive on the salty Martian rock

name: Tectonic Stress Power
text: Requires 2 science tags. Increase your energy production 3 steps
description: After finding ways to predict earthquakes, it was only a matter of time before it became feasible to exploit the enormous energies involved

name: Titanium Mine
text: Increase your titanium production 1 step
description: Titanium is useful to the space industry because of its great strength

name: Large Convoy
text: Place an ocean tile and draw 2 cards. Gain 5 plants, or add 4 animals to ANOTHER card.
description: Huge delivery from Earth

name: Imported Nitrogen
text: Raise your TR 1 step and gain 4 plants. Add 3 microbes to ANOTHER card and 2 animals to ANOTHER card.
description: Providing nitrogen needed in the atmosphere and for biomass

name: Magnetic Field Generators
text: Decrease your energy production 4 steps and increase your plant production 2 steps. Raise your TR 3 steps
description: By generating a magnetic field, you can protect organisms from cosmic radiaation

name: Imported GHG
text: Increase your heat production 1 step and gain 3 heat
description: Greenhouse gases (GHG) to retain the heat

name: Convoy From Europa
text: Place 1 ocean tile and draw 1 card
description: Bringing ice and other key supplies from the Jovian moon Europa

name: Power Supply Consortium
text: Requires 2 power tags. Decrease any energy production 1 step and increase your own 1 step.
description: Dominating the energy market allows you to make hostile takeovers

name: Lichen
text: Requires -24C or warmer. Increase your plant production 1 step.
description: Slow growing, but very resilient

name: Industrial Microbes
text: Increase your energy production and your steel production 1 step each
description: Fuel production and metal refining can be programmed into microorganisms

name: Nitrite Reducing Bacteria
action: Add 1 microbe to this card, or remove 3 microbes to increase your TR 1 step.
text: Add 3 microbes to this card
description: Making use of the nitrites in the ground to release nitrogen into the atmosphere

name: Standard Technology
effect: After you pay for a standard project, except selling patents, you gain 3 mega credits
description: Standard solutions honed to perfection

name: Designed Micro-organisms
text: It must be -14C or colder. Increase your plant production 2 steps
description: Specializing in extremely cold conditions

name: Caretaker Contract
action: Spend 8 heat to increase your terraforming rating 1 step
text: Requires 0C or warmer
description: In charge of establishing comfortable temperatures

name: Adaptation Technology
effect: Your global requirements are +2 or -2 steps, your choice in each case
description: Pushing the limits of the possible

name: Insulation
text: Decrease your heat production any number of steps and increase your mega credit production the same number of steps
description: Better insulation means lower energy spending

name: Investment Loan
text: Decrease your mega credit production 1 step. Gain 10 mega credit
description: Taking a loan to fund that urgent project

name: Mohole Area
text: Increase your heat production 4 steps. Place this tile ON AN AREA RESERVED FFOR OCEAN
description: Tunnels deep down to the molton magma, releasing heat and gases

name: Power Plant
text: Increase your energy production 1 step
description: Standard equipment, normal output

name: Lava Flows
text: Raise temperature 2 steps and place this tile ON EITHER THARSIS THOLUS, ASCRAEUS MONS, PAVONIS MONS OR ARSIA MONS
description: Releasing tremendous lava flows from one of Mars' gargantuan volcanoes

name: Wave Power
text: Requires 3 ocean tiles. Increase your energy production 1 step.
description: Well, see, first you need some waves...

name: Great Dam
text: Requires 4 ocean tiles. Increase your energy production 2 steps.
description: Letting natural processes do the work

name: Advanced Ecosystems
text: Requires a plant tag, a microbe tag, and an animal tag.
description: Constructing functional, dynamic ecosystems requires many ingredients

name: Extreme-Cold Fungus
action: Gain 1 plant or add 2 microbes to ANOTHER card.
text: It must be -10C or colder
description: Adapted strains able to form symbiotic relationships with other organisms

name: Symbiotic Fungus
action: Add a microbe to ANOTHER card.
text: Requires -14C or warmer.
description: Creating mutually beneficial conditions

name: Fusion Power
text: Requires 2 power tags. Increase your energy production 3 steps.
description: State of the art technology

name: Decomposers
effect: When you play an animal, plant, or microbe tag, including this, add a microbe to this card.
text: Requires 3% oxygen.
vp: 1 VP per 3 microbes on this card
description: Decomposing dead organisms is essential to making sustainable soil

name: Worms
text: Requires 4% oxygen. Increase your plant production 1 step for every 2 microbe tags you have, including this.
description: Milling about in the soil, 'processing' it

name: Zeppelins
text: Requires 5% oxygen. Increase your mega credit production 1 step for each city tile ON MARS.
description: A relatively cheap way to travel between cities across the planet

name: Ecological Zone
effect: When you play an animal or a plant tag (including these 2), add an animal to this card.
text: Requires that you have a greenery tile. Place this tile ADJACENT TO ANY GREENERY TILE.
vp: 1 VP per 2 animals on this card.
description: A secluded area where a multitude of species develop an ecosystem

name: Subterranean Reservoir
text: Place 1 ocean tile.
description: Also known as an aquifer. Burst one open and you've got a lot of water

name: GHG Factories
text: Decrease your energy production 1 step and increase your heat production 4 steps.
description: Synthesizing powerful greenhouse gases (GHGs), releasing them into the atmosphere

name: Hackers
text: Decrease your energy production 1 step and any mega credit production 2 steps. Increase your mega credit production 2 steps.
description: Very unethical, very illegal, very lucrative

name: Hired Raiders
text: Steal up to 2 steel, or 3 mega credit from any player
description: We have a better use for those resources

name: Industrial Center
action: Spend 7 mega credit to increase your steel production 1 step.
text: Place this tile ADJACENT TO A CITY TILE
description: Assigned to heavy industry, this area is not the nicest place on Mars

name: Moss
text: Requires 3 ocean tiles and that you lose 1 plant. Increase your plant production 1 step.
description: Efficient soil makers

name: Sabotage
text: Remove up to 3 titanium from any player, or 4 steel, or 7 mega credit
description: Nobody will know who did it.

name: Urbanized Area
text: Decrease your energy production 1 step and increase your mega credit production 2 steps. Place a city tile ADJACENT TO AT LEAST 2 OTHER CITY TILES
description: When the population begins to soar, cities will eventually merge into large urban areas

name: Dust Seals
text: Requires 3 or less ocean tiles
description: Tight seals to keep micron-sized dust out of buildings, vehicles and suits

name: Farming
text: Requires +4C or warmer. Increase your mega credit production 2 steps and your plant production 2 steps. Gain 2 plants
description: At last we can have a decent food production allowing for rapid population increase

name: Great Escarpment Consortium
text: Requires that you have steel production. Decrease any steel production 1 step and increase your own 1 step.
description: The border between the northern plains and the southern highlands is rich in minerals. Control it, and you will control the global mining business

name: Trans-Neptune Probe
description: Exploring the Kupier belt objects

name: Beam From A Thorium Asteroid
text: Required a jovian tag. Increase your heat production and energy production 3 steps each
description: Nuclear energy is safe, especially when located on a remote asteroid rich in radioactive elements

name: Open City
text: Requires 12% oxygen. Decrease your energy production 1 step and increase your mega credit production 4 steps. Gain 2 plants and place a city tile.
description: Not very comfortable conditions yet, but what freedom!!

name: Asteroid Mining Consortium
text: Requires that you have titanium production. Decrease any titanium production 1 step and increase your own 1 step
description: Your hold on the titanium market tightens

name: Gene Repair
text: Requires 3 science tags. Increase your mega credit production 2 steps.
description: Counters the inevitable damage from cosmic radiation and reverses many aging symptoms

name: Solar Power
text: Increase your energy production 1 step
description: Perhaps the most readily available energy source on Mars

name: Asteroid Mining
text: Increase your titanium production 2 steps
description: Where gravity is low and rare minerals abound

name: Natural Preserve
text: Oxygen must be 4% or less. Place this tile NEXT TO NO OTHER TILE. Increase your mega credit production 1 step
description: Creating a national park with original Martian landforms and environments

name: Media Archives
text: Gain 1 mega credit for each event EVER PLAYED by all players
description: Accessing information on past events for better planning of the future

name: Bushes
text: Requires -10C or warmer. Increase your plant production 2 steps. Gain 2 plants
description: Giving some wind protection for smaller species

name: Artificial Photosynthesis
text: Increase your plant production 1 step or your energy production 2 steps
description: Artificial photosynthesis was achieved chemically by prof Akermark et. al. in 2021. Its application to terraforming remains to be seen

name: Cupola City
text: Oxygen must be 9% or less. Place a city tile. Decrease your energy production 1 step and increase your mega credit production 3 steps
description: In a thin atmosphere, normal pressure can hold up a protective dome over the city

name: Mining Area
text: Place this tile on an area with a steel or titanium placement bonus, adjacent to another of your tiles. Increase your production of that resource 1 step
description: It is easier to claim territories where you already have established activities

name: Geothermal Power
text: Increase your energy production 2 steps
description: Utilizing heat from the core through the cracks in the crust

name: Peroxide Power
text: Decrease your mega credit production 1 step and increase your energy production 2 steps
description: The Martian ground is full of oxidizing agents

name: archaebacteria
text: It must be -18C or colder. Increase your plant production 1 step
description: Photosynthesizing bacteria specializing in extreme environments

name: Building Industries
text: Decrease your energy production 1 step and increase your steel production 2 steps
description: Accelerating building of the infrastructure

name: Equatorial Magnetizer
action: Decrease your energy production 1 step to increase your terraform rating 1 step
description: Super-conducting wires encircling the globe to create a magnetic field

name: Steelworks
action: Spend 4 energy to gain 2 steel and increase oxygen 1 step
description: Turning the soil into steel and oxygen sounds good. It just takes a lot of energy

name: Advanced Alloys
effect: Each titanium you have is worth 1 mega credit extra. Each steel you have is worth 1 mega credit extra
description: The latest advances in metallurgy give you an edge in the competition

name: Earth Office
effect: When you play an earth tag, you pay 3 mega credit less for it
description: Coordinating deliveries and homeworld support

name: Space Mirrors
action: Spend 7 mega credit to increase your energy production 1 step
description: Ultrathin mirrors reflecting sunlight down to receivers on the surface

name: Space Elevator
action: Spend 1 steel to gain 5 mega credits
text: Increase your titanium production 1 step.
description: An ultra-strong cable car up to geo-stationary orbit, enabling reasonable export costs

name: Space Station
effect: When you play a space card, you pay 2 mega credits less for it
description: Buy it today at www.fryxgames.se

effect: When you play a card, you pay 2 mega credits less for it
name: Earth Catapult
description: When export from Earth becomes easier, everything gets cheaper

name: Ganymede Colony
text: Place a city tile ON THE RESERVED AREA.
vp: 1 VP per jovian tag you have
description: Settling the biggest moon of the biggest planet

name: Capital
text: Requires 4 ocean tiles. Place this tile. Decrease your energy production 2 steps and increase your mega credit production 5 steps.
vp: 1 ADDITIONAL VP FOR EACH OCEAN TILE ADJACENT TO THIS CITY TILE
description: With its ideal placement and all its facilities, this is the true capital of Mars

name: Comet
text: Raise temperature 1 step and place an ocean tile. Remove up to 3 plants from any player
description: Prepare to be catered!

name: Business Contacts
text: LOOK AT THE TOP 4 CARDS FROM THE DECK. TAKE 2 OF THEM INTO HAND AND DISCARD THE OTHER 2
description: Money and information are often interchangeable

name: Mining Expedition
text: Raise oxygen 1 step. Remove 2 plants from any player. Gain 2 steel
description: Ruthlessly excavating rich areas

name: Release of Inert Gases
text: Raise your terraform rating 2 steps
description: We need some nitrogen and other inert gases to increase atmospheic pressure. Let's stay away from helium, though

name: Mineral Deposit
text: Gain 5 steel
description: Still mostly untouched, Mars offers easy access to many useful minerals

name: Ore Processor
action: Spend 4 energy to gain 1 titanium and increase oxygen 1 step
description: Processing ore

name: Land Claim
text: PLACE YOUR MARKER ON A NON-RESERVED AREA. ONLY YOU MAY PLACE A TILE HERE
description: Acquiring strategic land areas

name: AI Central
action: Draw 2 cards
text: Requires 3 science tags to play. Decrease your energy production 1 step

name: Medical Lab
text: Increase your mega credit production 1 step for every 2 building tags you have, including this
description: Providing health care for the public can be lucrative, as well as noble

name: Special Design
text: The next card you play this generation is +2 or -2 in global requirements, your choice
description: If it isn't feasible, then make it so

name: Rad-chem Factory
text: Decrease your energy production 1 step. Raise your terraform rating 2 steps
description: Certain aromatic compounds can absorb dangerous radiation without breaking

name: Technology Demonstration
text: Draw 2 cards
description: Testing launch techniques, space hardware, and whatnot

name: Soletta
text: Decrease your heat production 7 steps
description: Huge ultra-thin mirrors focusing sunlight onto the red planet

name: Underground Detonations
action: Spend 10 mega credit to increase your heat production 2 steps
description: Radiation from the nuclear blsst is shielded, but over time, we are stil getting the heat

name: Energy Tapping
text: Decrease any energy production 1 step and increase your own 1 step
description: They need it. But we neet it more

name: Immigrant City
effect: Each time a city tile is placed, including this, increase your mega credit production 1 step
text: Decrease your energy production 1 step and decrease your mega credit production 2 steps. Place a city tile
description: Taking care of immigrants is costly, but will begin to pay off when they start working for you in the growing society

name: Restricted Area
action: Spend 2 mega credit to draw a card
text: Place this tile
description: A place to conduct secret research, preventing the wrong people from getting in. Or out

name: Immigration Shuttles
Increase your mega credit production 5 steps.
vp: 1 VP for every 3rd city in play
description: The new world attracts ever more immigrants from the old

name: Terraforming Ganymede
text: Raise your terraform rating 1 step for each jovian tag you have, including this
description: Why stop at Mars?

name: Ice Asteroid
text: Place 2 ocean tiles
description: We need its water down here

name: Imported Hydrogen
text: Gain 3 plants, or add 3 microbes or 2 animals to ANOTHER card. Place an ocean tile
description: A light-weight but expensive crucial element

name: Big Asteroid
text: Raise temperature 2 steps and gain 4 timtanium. Remove up to 4 plants from any player
description: There are many unpopulated areas to crash it on

name: Nitrogen-Rich Asteroid
text: Raise your terraform rating 2 steps and temperature 1 step. Increase your plant production 1 step, or 4 steps if you have 3 plant tags
description: Adding nitrogen to mars will both thicken the atmosphere with N2 and provide fertilizer for plants

name: Virus
text: Remove up to 2 animals or 5 plants from any player
description: The virus is transient, changing from liquid to air-borne to blood transfusion

name: Deimos Down
text: Raise temperature 3 steps and gain 4 steel. Remove up to 8 plants from any player
description: We don't use that moon anyway

name: Bribed Committe
text: Raise your terraform rating 2 steps
description: Influencing the people in power

name: Security Fleet
action: Spend 1 titanium to add 1 fighter resource to this card
vp: 1 vp for each fighter resource on this card
description: Keeping the peace by force

name: Solar Wind Power
text: Increase your energy production 1 step and gain 2 titanium
description: Working those solar storms to your advantage

name: Towing A Comet
text: Gain 2 plants. Raise oxygen level 1 step and place an ocean tile
description: By aerobraking it we get its contents without the impact

name: 10 Mining Industries
text: Increase your titanium production 2 steps and your mega credit production 2 steps
vp: 1 VP per jovian tag you have
description: Supplying fuel and valuable minerals

name: Callisto Penal Mines
text: Increase your mega credit production 3 steps
description: You always wanted to be a warden, didn't you?

name: Small Animals
action: Add 1 animal to this card
text: Requires 6% oxygen. Decrease any plant production 1 step.
vp: 1 VP per 2 animals on this card
description: Able to live in sparse conditions

name: Kelp Farming
text: Requires 6 ocean tiles. Increase your mega credit production 2 steps and your plant production 3 steps. Gain 2 plants
description: The newly formed oceans are very rich in minerals, perfect for food production

name: Tardigrades
action: Add 1 microbe to this card
vp: 1 VP per 4 microbes on this card
description: These microscopic creatures can survive freezing, boiling, drying out, heavy radiation, and brute force

name: Fish
action: Add 1 animal to this card
text: Requires +2C or warmer. Decrease any plant production 1 step.
vp: 1 VP for each animal on this card
description: Martian barracudas? Why not!

name: Algae
text: Requires 5 ocean tiles. Gain 1 plant and increase your plant production 2 steps
description: Basic photosynthesizers in aqueous environments

name: Power Grid
text: Increase your energy production 1 step for each power tag you have, including this
description: Making efficient use of your energy production

name: Mine
text: Increase your steel production 1 step
description: Mars' main export industry also supplies the planet with construction materials

name: Deep Well Heating
text: Increase your energy production 1 step. Increase temperature 1 step
description: Digging deep to find heat from the core

name: Underground City
text: Place a city tile. Decrease your energy production 2 steps and increase your steel production 2 steps
description: Excavating is expensive, but gives both protection and building materials

name: Grass
text: Requires -16C or warmer. Increase your plant production 1 step. Gain 3 plants
description: Taking root in every crevice and patch of soil

name: Fueled Generators
text: Decrease your mega credit production 1 step and increase your energy production 1 step
description: Simple but limited power supply

name: Acquired Company
text: Increase your mega credit production 3 steps
description: This interplanetary company will surely pay off

name: Adapted Lichen
text: Increase your plant production 1 step
description: Suitable even for early terraforming

name: Quantum Extractor
effect: When you play a space card, you pay 2 mega credit less for it
text: Requires 4 science tags. Increase your energy production 4 steps
description: Tapping the very fabric of space

name: Giant Space Mirror
text: Increase your energy production 3 steps
description: Square kilometers of extra sunlight reflected down to a receiving power plant

name: Vesta Shipyard
text: Increase your titanium production 1 step
description: The pride of the asteriod belt

name: Asteroid
text: Raise temperature 1 step and gain 2 titanium. Remove up to 3 plants from any player
description: What are those plants doing in our impact zone?

name: Cloud Seeding
text: Requires 3 ocean tiles. Decrease your mega credit production 1 step and any heat production 1 step. Increase your plant production 2 steps
description: Lessens solar influx, but enhances plant growth

name: Giant Ice Asteroid
text: Raise temperature 2 steps and place 2 ocean tiles. Remove up to 6 plants from any player
description: Crash it. The bigger, the better

name: Sponsors
text: Increase your mega credit production 2 steps
description: Willing to support your projects

name: Inventors' Guild
action: LOOK AT THE TOP CARD AND EITHER BUY IT OR DISCARD IT
description: When great minds meet, new ideas abound

name: Water Import From Europa
action: Pay 12 mega credit to place an ocean tile. TITANIUM MAY BE USED as if playing a space card
vp: 1 VP for each jovian tag you have
description: With its low gravity, this Jovian ice moon is suitable for mass export of water

name: Search For Life
action: Spend 1 mega credit to reveal and discard the top of the draw deck. If that card has a microbe tag, add a science resource here
text: Oxygen must be 6% or less.
vp: 3 VPs if you have one or more science resources here
description: Finding native life-forms would be the greatest discovery in history, so let's find out!

name: Martian Rails
action: Spend 1 energy to gain 1 mega credit for each city tile ON MARS
description: Fast and cheap transportation for goods and guys

name: Electro Catapult
action: Spend 1 plant or 1 steel to gain 7 mega credit
text: Oxygen must be 8% or less. Decrease your energy production 1 step
desription: A 200km long acceleration ramp up the side of Pavonis Mons, hurtling export goods into space

name: Ironworks
action: Spend 4 energy to gain 1 steel and increase oxygen 1 step
description: Electrolysis of Martian soil yields both iron and oxygen, making it an important part of terraforming

name: Rover Construction
effect: When any city tile is placed, gain 2 mega credit
description: Providing safe transport vehicles

name: Domed Crater
text: Oxygen must be 7% or less. Gain 3 plants and place a city tile. Decrease your energy production 1 step and increase mega credit production 3 steps
description: A spacious area for a great city

name: Development Center
action: Spend 1 energy to draw a card
description: Ensuring a constant influx of ideas

name: Methane From Titan
text: Requires 2% oxygen. Increase your heat production 2 steps and your plant production 2 steps
description: Using Titan's liquid methane as fuel will add carbon and heat to Mars

name: Predators
action: Remove 1 animal from any card any add it to this card
text: Requires 11% oxygen
vp: 1 VP per animal on this card
description: Lions and tigers and bears, oh my

name: Black Polar Dust
text: Place an ocean tile. Decrease your mega credit production 2 steps and increase your heat production 3 steps
description: The sprinkled dust absorbs heat from the sun. Must be renewed after each snowfall, though

name: Research Outpost
effect: When you play a card, you pay 1 mega credit less for it
text: Place a city tile NEXT TO NO OTHER TILE
description: Finding new ways to do things

name: Noctis City
text: Decrease your energy production 1 step and increase your mega credit production 3 steps. Place a city tile ON THE RESERVED AREA, disregarding normal placement restrictions
description: In Noctis Labyrinthus, where the mist is gray

name: Phobos Space Haven
text: Increase your titanium production 1 step and place a city tile ON THE RESERVED AREA
description: The doorway to mars

name: Arctic Algae
effect: When anyone places an ocean tile, gain 2 plants
text: It must be -12C or colder to play. Gain 1 plant
description: Suitable for freezing temperatures

name: Interstellar Colony Ship
text: Requires 5 science tags
description: To new horizons and an unknown galaxy

name: Optimal Aerobraking
effect: When you play a space event, you gain 3 mega credit and 3 heat
description: Perfecting the art of ballistic and material analysis can increase efficiency and save money

name: Lunar Beam
text: Decrease your mega credit production 2 steps and increase your heat production and energy production 2 steps each
description: A huge energy beam. Difficult to collect, but who cares?

name: EOS Chasma National Park
text: Requires -12C or warmer. Add 1 animal TO ANY ANIMAL CARD. Gain 3 plants. Increase your mega credit production 2 steps
description: A wonder of the world, doing wonders for the tourism business

name: Robotic Workforce
text: Duplicate only the production box of one of your building cards
description: Enhancing your production capacity

name: Heather
text: Requires -14C or warmer. Increase your plant production 1 step. Gain 1 plant
description: Stabilizing the soil

name: Research
text: Counts as playing 2 science cards. Draw 2 cards
description: Through technical excellence you will unlock many wondrous things

name: Regolith Eaters
action: Add 1 microbe to this card, or remove 2 microbes from this card to raise oxygen level 1 step
description: Living on the rocks and excreting oxygen

name: Media Group
effect: After you play an event card, you gain 3 mega credit
description: Profiting on every spectacular story

name: Nuclear Zone
text: Place this tile and raise temperature 2 steps
description: Detonating obsolete nuclear weapons from Earth is an efficient method for raising the temperature

name: Toll Station
text: Increase your mega credit production 1 step for each space tag your OPPONENTS have
description: Licensed by the 'government'

name: Physics Complex
action: Spend 6 energy to add a science resource to this card
vp: 2 VP for each science resource on this card
description: This used to cause blackouts before the invention of supercomputers

name: Mass Converter
effect: When you play a space card, you pay 2 mega credit less for it
text: Requires 5 science tags. Increase your energy production 6 steps
description: E=mc^2. 1 kg = a LOT of energy

name: Greenhouses
text: Gain 1 plant for each city tile in play
description: Places to conduct bio research and experiments

name: Artificial Lake
text: Requires -6C or warmer. Place 1 ocean tile ON AN AREA NOT RESERVED FOR OCEAN
description: Landscaping is as natural as terraforming

name: Business Network
action: Look at the top card and either buy it or discard it
text: Decrease your mega credit production 1 step
description: Investing in social events can open up new opportunities

name: GHG Producing Bacteria
action: Add 1 microbe to this card, or remove 2 microbes to raise temperature 1 step
text: Requires 4% oxygen
description: Working for the biosphere and the atmosphere at the same time

name: Ants
action: Remove 1 microbe from any card to add 1 to this card
text: Requires 4% oxygen
vp: 1 VP per 2 microbes on this card
description: Although an important part of many ecosystems, ants can also be detrimental to other organisms

name: Birds
action: Add an animal to this card
text: Requires 13% oxygen. Decrease any plant production 2 steps
vp: 1 VP for each animal on this card
description: Bringing life to the skies

name: Mars University
effect: When you play a science tag, including this, you may discard a card from hand to draw a card
description: A major step towards understanding Mars

name: Viral Enhancers
effect: When you play a plant, microbe, or an animal tag, including this, gain 1 plant or add 1 resource TO THAT CARD
description: Genetically engineered virus strains can be used to introduce favorable genes to other organisms

name: Carbonate Processing
text: Decrease your energy production 1 step and increase your heat production 3 steps
description: Common minerals can be converted into carbon dioxide that increases the greenhouse effect

name: Nuclear Power
text: Increase your mega credit production 2 steps and increase your energy production 3 steps
description: A simple way to satisfy your energy needs

name: Lightning Harvest
text: Requires 3 science tags. Increase your energy production and your mega credit production 1 step each
description: Floating supercapacitors connecting clouds with a superconducting wire. The triggered and collected discharges are beamed down to a receptor

name: Mining Rights
text: Place this tile on an area with a steel or titanium placement bonus. Increase that production 1 step
description: The battles for Martian riches sometimes begin in a courtroom

name: Miranda Resort
text: Increase your mega credit production 1 step for each Earth tag you have
description: Situated on Verona Rupes, the highest vertical drop in the solar system, the resort attracts many of the thrill-seekers among the rich on Earth

name: Breathing Filters
text: Requires 7% oxygen
description: Allowing easy access to the still quite harsh environment

name: Trees
text: Requires -4C or warmer. Increase your plant production 3 steps. Gain 1 plant
description: Providing fruits, wood, and new habitats

name: Mangrove
text: Requires +4C or warmer. Place a greenery tile ON AN AREA RESERVED FOR OCEAN and raise oxygen 1 step. Disregard normal placement restrictions for this
description: A wetland forest will create an ecosystem where new species can thrive

name: Commercial District
text: Decrease your energy production 1 step and increase your mega credit production 4 steps. Place this tile.
description: Taking advantage of dense population centers

name: Lake Marineris
text: Requires 0C or warmer. Place 2 ocean tiles
description: Filling the Valles Marineris takes a lot of water

name: Tropical Resort
text: Decrease your heat production 2 steps and increase your mega credit production 3 steps
description: Utilizing heat production to attract tourists

name: Colonizer Training Camp
text: Oxygen must be 5% or less
description: Preparing for settlement of the moons of Jupiter

name: Food Factory
text: Decrease your plant production 1 step and increase your mega credit production 4 steps
description: For the growing population
